alert.note: Alert for Baker (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 7:59AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Florida, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Baker, Clay, Duval, Putnam and St. Johns. In northern Florida, Bradford. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain over the area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Saint Augustine, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Keystone Heights, Fruit Cove, Mandarin, Middleburg, Unf, Arlington, Ponte Vedra Beach, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Neptune Beach, World Golf Village, Saint Augustine Beach, Fleming Island, Switzerland and Doctors Inlet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
